VISUAL-DESCRIPTION_1: Enter two prime numbers. If done, this unlocks the next 4 parameters where you can either enter the value by yourself or make this plugin calculate it by clicking on the pen-loased symbol. A fast path is to click on the button 'Generate another set of parameters', which enters valid values for all 6 fields. After having valid values in all fields you can start the graphics by pressing 'Automatic run'.
VISUAL-DESCRIPTION_2: Calculate phi and n right to unlock the next numbers. You can fill these numbers automatically, just press the pen symbol.
VISUAL-PHI-LCM-DESCRIPTION: Choose a number e which is coprime to φ(n) and for which the following applies 1 < e < φ(n)
VISUAL-E-HAS-BE-COPRIME-TO-PLACEHOLDER: e has to be coprime to
VISUAL-D-HAS-BE-CONGRUENT-TO-E-PLACEHOLD: d has to be congruent to e
VISUAL-E-EQUAL-D: e and d are right, but they should not be the same. You could try to change e.
VISUAL-N-GREATER-200: Your n has to be smaller than or equal 200 to use the visualition. You can generate a random keypair, where n is smaller than 200 with the button 'Generate another set of parameters'.
VISUAL-OVERWRITE-RSA-PARAMETER: If you press 'Yes', it will overwrite the current RSA parameters and reset the graphics. Continue?
VISUAL-GENERATE-NEW-KEY-AND-OVERWRITE: If you press 'Yes', it will reset the graphics and take over the new parameters. Continue?
VISUAL-SUCCESS-VALID-KEY-FEEDBACK: Now you can start the visualization by clicking on 'Automatic execution' below
DIDACTIC-KEY-GEN-IMPORT-THIS-KEYPAIR-BUT: Import this keypair to my keystore
DIDACTIC-KEY-GEN-IMPORT-PUBLIC-KEYPAIR-S: Import public key to my keystore
DIDACTIC-KEY-GEN-IMPORT-PRIVATE-KEYPAIR-: Import private key to my keystore
DIDACTIC-ENC-KEY-INVALID: Your keypair is not valid, if you do not have a keypair, generate a key in the tab RSA key generation and import it into the table to use it.
DIDACTIC-ENC-ALPHABET-WARNING: The alphabet has to consist of more than one char
DIDACTIC-ENC-PLACEHOLDER: Enter text or numbers to encrypt/decrypt
DIDACTIC-ENC-INPUT-SEPARATED-IN-BLOCKS: The input get separated in blocks of length
DIDACTIC-ENC-NUMBER-DECRYPTION-IN-BLOCKS: Output from decryption in blocks of length
DIDACTIC-ENC-NUMBER-ENCRYPTION-IN-BLOCKS: Output from encryption in blocks of length
DIDACTIC-ENC-INVALID-INPUT: Input is not valid, cannot decode into text representation
DIDACTIC-KEY-INVALID-IMPORTED-FILE: The following imported file is not valid
DIDACTIC-KEY-INPUT-LESSER-THAN-N: Input has to be lesser then n.
DIDACTIC-LINK-TO-STEPBYSTEP: Note: The formulas of RSA are explained in more detail in the plugin RSA (step-by-step).
GENERALLY-ARE-YOU-SURE: Are you sure, you want delete
GENERALLY-WARNING-OVERWRITE-PROGRESS: This would overwrite your progress. Continue?
GENERALLY-P-FEEDBACK-P-EQUAL-Q: p and q cannot be the same
GENERALLY-Q-FEEDBACK-Q-EQUAL-P: q and p cannot be the same
GENERALLY-E-FEEDBACK-POSITIV: Very good, e is coprime to
GENERALLY-E-FEEDBACK-GREATER: e is not valid because it is greater than
GENERALLY-E-NO-NUMBER-EXIST: There is no number e, that is coprime to
GENERALLLY-INPUT-PLACEHOLDER: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
REAL-USE-CMD-INFO: Based on OpenSSL v3.0.0Usage: openssl command [ options ] [ arguments ]More info:
REAL-USE-OVERWRITE-FILE-TEXT: Are you sure, you want to overwrite the file
REAL-USE-DELETE-FILE-TEXT: Are you sure, you want to delete this file?
REAL-USE-CHECKING-RSA-KEY: Checking uploaded file, if its a rsa key
REAL-USE-CHECKING-CER: Checking uploaded file, if its a x509 Certifikate
